intro: Pabstiella eunapolitana, commonly known as the Mexican mountain morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its heliotropic flowers that follow the sun's movement. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces vibrant purple or blue flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in rocky or arid environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
